titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the New-York Historical Society Development Office Records
1956-2012 (bulk, 1982-1990s)
NYHS-RG 25
titlestmt.author: Larry Weimer

sponsor.emph: This record group was processed as part of the 2015-2016 N-YHS Institutional Archives project, made possible by a generous grant from the Leon Levy Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-25 10:05:36 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: New-York Historical Society Development Office records (RESTRICTED)

physdesc.extent: in 68 boxes of various sizes and 5 boxes of oversize computer print-outs

did.abstract: The Development Office records include files concerning N-YHS's fundraising initiatives for exhibitions, collections conservation and preservation, cataloging, education programs, publications, physical plant improvements, general operating support, and other purposes. Sources of grants and other funds documented in the record group include government agencies, foundations, corporations, trustees, other individuals, memberships, and benefit events. The bulk of the records date from the 1980s and the early 1990s, with some files ranging back to the 1950s.The record group has not yet been vetted by the Development Office for public use and is therefore currently restricted.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The documents in the record group are in English.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: The Development Office records are organized in six series:

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The Development Office record group remains restricted because it has not been reviewed with the Office to determine which records may be made publicly available.
Materials are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.

Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as the New-York Historical Society Development Office records (NYHS-RG 25), The New-York Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials Note
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the New-York Historical Society archives. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the New-York Historical Society Archives (NYHS-RG Archives). Other record groups that are processed and available to researchers and are especially related to the New-York Historical Society Development Office records (NYHS-RG 25) are as follows:

Both the New-York Historical Society Museum Department records (NYHS-RG 20) and the New-York Historical Society Library Department records (NYHS-RG 21) include files concerning grants and the grant-funded exhibitions, projects and other initiatives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Development Office records include files concerning N-YHS's fundraising initiatives for exhibitions, collections conservation and preservation, cataloging, education programs, publications (including catalogues and the Encyclopedia of New York City), physical plant improvements, general operating support, and other purposes. Sources of grants and other funds documented in the record group include government agencies, foundations, corporations, trustees, other individuals, memberships, and benefit events (including the first History Makers galas, held in 1988 and 1989). The bulk of the records date from the 1980s to the 1990s, with some files ranging back to the 1950s.

The records include files of grant applications (both approved and declined) and related correspondence and reports, subject files for specific fundraising objectives and events, corporate and foundation prospect files, donor contribution records, and membership event and benefit logistical arrangements.

accruals.head: Accruals Note
accruals.p: Further accruals to the record group are expected over time.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The record group has been minimally processed. The bulk (Series I through V) were processed in 2016 by archivist Larry Weimer during the project funded by the Leon Levy Foundation. An additional accession was received from the Development Office in 2019 and this was added to the finding aid by Weimer in August 2021.

controlaccess.subject: Fund raising
Grants-in-aid.
Learned institutions and societies -- New York (State) -- New York.

did.unittitle: Series I. Grants

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This series includes grant applications and related instructions, correspondence, drafts, working files, acknowledgements, interim and final reports, and other documents. The files include both grant requests approved and declined/rejected. The grants pertain almost entirely to government grants, with only occasional reference to foundation or other private grants. These files include grant requests for conservation and preservation, cataloging, exhibitions, educational programs, and general operating support. The container list includes more specific references as to content at the box and folder level. The bulk of the material dates from the 1980s, especially the mid to late 1980s. A few files date from the late 1970s and early 1980s, and a few date from the early 1990s. Although the bulk of the files appear to have come from the Development Department, many of the files in the final box of the series, from the early 1990s, appear to have come from the files of N-YHS President Barbara Knowles Debs, and were likely moved here by a processing archivist in the early 2000s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: With minor exception, the files are in original order as found during processing in December 2016. Although the series is arranged by grant funding organization, there appear to be four rough sets of the files: first, a set of core files from the Development Office; second, a set of what appears to be mostly rejected applications; third, a set of various files likely found after the first two sets were boxed for storage; and a fourth with later (early 1990s) material. The Bond Act files, found separately by the processing archivist in 2016, were added to the end of the series.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: The bulk of the series was processed in 2016 by project archivist Larry Weimer. The series was minimally processed and so most of the files remain in their original folders.

did.unittitle: New York Council for the Humanities (3 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes photo survey proposal (declined) and film on Theresa Bernstein.

did.unittitle: New York City Department of Cultural Affairs (6 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes public services/programs and education funding.

did.unittitle: New York State Council on the Arts (10 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes exhibition planning, collections maintenance, Calyo audience survey, Luman Reed frames, paper conservation studio.

did.unittitle: New York State Council on the Arts (7 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes Bracklow, de Tocqueville, de Neuville, and other exhibitions, and furniture conservation.

did.unittitle: Institute of Museum Services (IMS)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes furniture conservation.

did.unittitle: Institute of Museum Services (IMS) (2 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes painting and paper conservation labs (includes floor plan).

did.unittitle: National Endowment for the Arts (NEA) (6 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes conservation (hot table), exhibitions (Niagara; Bracklow; American Landscape Painting, Genre Art & Drawing (includes photographs); and Nieuw Amsterdam), and development of a narrated slide presentation as an introduction to N-YHS's collections.

did.unittitle: National Endowment for the Arts (NEA) (8 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes storage space renovation, Audubon installation, conservation of paintings, catalogue of paintings, survey and exhibitions of furniture and other decorative arts objects, and Manhattan Now exhibition.

did.unittitle: New York State Commission on the Bicentennial of the United States Constitution

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes mock Constitutional Conventions for school age students, an outgrowth of the Summer Institutes.

did.unittitle: New York State Department of Education (3 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes Henry O'Reilly collection processing, American Art Union and Daniel Ullman preservation microfilming, and conservation of McComb City Hall drawings.

did.unittitle: National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) (4 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes conservation of Nicolino Calyo paintings and funding for the exhibition Government by Choice: Inventing the U.S. Constitution, including photographs of documents used in the exhibition.

did.unittitle: National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) (2 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes newspaper cataloging and exhibition Centuries of Childhood in New York, including photographic contact sheets and negatives of the galleries.

did.unittitle: Encyclopedia of New York City

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes correspondence concerning fundraising for this project. See also the files below in Series II.B (Subject Files).

did.unittitle: National Historical Publications Records Commission (NHPRC)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes architectural collections.

did.unittitle: Summer History Institute

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes plans, proposals, correspondence, etc. related to general fundraising for the program.

did.unittitle: United States Department of Justice. Sharing the Spirit (4 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes programs funded by DOJ's Commission on the Bicentennial of the United States Constitution, including the radio series "Constitution on the Air" and "The Bicentennial Connection."

did.unittitle: United States Department of Education. Summer History Institute
United States Department of Education. (7 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes book, manuscript and map cataloging, Rufus King Library conservation and cataloging, and Landauer Collection conservation. Funding for some of these appears to have been declined.

did.unittitle: Rejected Applications (11 of 13 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: All the files in this box appear to be unsuccessful or general information files. Includes NEH (U.S. photograph survey, Landauer collection, conservation survey, Luman Reed planning, Rivey painting conservation) and NEA (China Trade exhibition, paintings storage).

did.unittitle: Rejected Applications (2 of 13 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes NEA (paper conservation studio, architectural collections).

did.unittitle: National Endowment for the Arts (NEA) (2 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes conservation of Catlin drawings and exhibition 500 Years of American Clothing.

did.unittitle: National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes conservation planning for Audubon drawings (declined).

did.unittitle: National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) (5 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes physical plant renovations (declined), cataloging of silver collection (declined), and cataloging and preservation of Cass Gilbert collection.

did.unittitle: New York State Department of Education (3 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes conservation of McComb City Hall drawings and conservation of maps (declined).

did.unittitle: United States Department of Education

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes map cataloging.

did.unittitle: Institute of Museum Services (IMS) (4 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes general operating support and paper conservation studio.

did.unittitle: New York State Council on the Arts (3 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes arts-in-education requests and "Why History?" and other programs.

did.unittitle: New State State Library

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes acknowledgement of grant for conservation of Erskine-DeWitt maps.

did.unittitle: New York State Council for the Humanities
National Endowment for the Arts (NEA) (5 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes Cass Gilbert, photograph database, and other proposals.

did.unittitle: Institute of Museum Services (IMS) (3 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes conservation and general operating support.

did.unittitle: National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) (8 folders)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Renovation of physical plant and collection re-housing/storage, book and pamphlet cataloging, negative preservation, Tenth Street Studio exhibition and publication, images of Indians exhibition, and establishment of endowments.

did.unittitle: New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation (1 of 2 boxes)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: This box and the next concerns N-YHS's application and receipt of a grant under the Environmental Quality Bond Act of 1986 (EQBA) for preservation of its building, specifically roof restoration. The second box includes extensive photographs and slides of the roof, damage, etc.

did.unittitle: New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation (2 of 2 boxes)
Series VI. Event Collateral Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes a run of "collateral" documents related to fundraisers, History Makers Gala, invitation-only events (such as exhibition opening receptions, Strawberry Festival, etc.), and other events other than those for the general public. These materials date principally from 1998 to the 2010s. They include event programs, invitations, announcements, and the like. The series also includes assorted digital media (DVDs/CDs re: object images, programs, etc.), videocassettes, and audiocassettes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The paper files of collateral material are arranged as received from the Development Office, which is by topic (general collateral, particular type of event, etc.), then chronological. The digital and audiovisual media are unsorted.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The series includes materials transferred to the archives in 2019 (NYHS.2019.009). It was added to the finding aid in August 2021 by archivist Larry Weimer, re-boxed, and moved offsite. Excess copies of the collateral material were discarded.

did.unittitle: Event invitations, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a few folders of miscellaneous invitations, brochures, etc. from the 1990s and into the early 2000s. The bulk of the box includes folders of material filed by year from 1998-2010.

did.unittitle: Event invitations, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes files of invitations and other collateral material for: a few exhibitions (2004-2010), opening of the Dimenna Children's Museum (2010), re-opening N-YHS post-renovation (2011), American Musicals Project (2012), Weekend with History (2006-11, with gaps), History Makers Gala (2004-2011), and Strawberry Festival (2004-2012). The box also holds packets of snapshots of events, though these are mostly unidentified.

did.unittitle: Videocassettes
Videocassettes; Audiocassettes, Digital CDs/DVDs
